items.title: header management for XHR fallback requests
items.body:
I understand that browsers do not let websocket requests being modified by SockJS. 
But is there a way to modify the headers for the XHR requests that are used as fallbacks when websocket is not available? 

I need to implement CSRF headers specifically. I'm using Spring as a backend, and CSRF support in websocket is enabled and working, but when I disable websocket to test the fallback queries, the CSRF protection prevents them from working.

Right now, it means I have to disable CSRF server-side protection for any fallback query but this is not the most secure way.

items.title: Why is the code and reason passed in by the close method invalid?
items.body:
https://github.com/sockjs/sockjs-client/blob/3ccf61d256f13d6108870e5057363df9779e2b14/lib/main.js#L329

https://github.com/sockjs/sockjs-client/blob/3ccf61d256f13d6108870e5057363df9779e2b14/lib/main.js#L339

if i understand correctly, `this._transport` is a WebSocket object. however, the passed in `code` and `reason` is not passed into `this._transport.close` method.

is this the design? or what did i miss?

items.title: Load testing strategy
items.body:
Hi, 

I wrote a socket server using sockjs. It works fine on development environment. Now I would like to make some load tests, eg. to test the limit of concurrent connections on production server. As far as I know I can't use browser script because of max concurrent connections limitation, and the sockjs-client seems to require browser to run (there are some window.document references). I tried to run it from node.js but it returns with code 2000 - no transports found. 

So my question is what is the best strategy to simulate large number od sockjs connections messages? Do you have any advice or examples (eg. a script, Artillery setup) to run multiple clients simultaneously? If I come up with something I can post it here but any tips will be very appreciated.

items.title: GET https://localhost/sockjs-node/info?t=1580200999862 net::ERR_CONNECTION_REFUSED
Failed to create WebSocket connection , getting 405 ( Request method 'POST' not supported )
Console error "SCRIPT445: Object doesn't support this action" only in IE11 where emit is triggered when socket is closed on unload
"close" does not work if stuck on InfoReceiver
items.body:
Our setup is pretty straight forward. SockJS 1.4 with a timeout of 5 seconds, handled by StompJS with a reconnect time of 1 second.

Sometimes, our backend takes longer than one second to respond to the /info call, and StompJS tries to close it to reopen it again, and in fact, it is just doing it fine by calling the "close" method in sockJs. I know that SockJS acknowledge the close operation because I see the "disconnected" entry just fine. Problem is that, it is not really closed, InfoReceiver continued going forward. And this is how I think I sometimes end up having 2 websocket sessions.

I attach a log of the relevant part. Log entries starting with "STOMP: " is the logging from StompJS. log entry like "Before connect - retry attempt X" is just the stompJs callback "beforeConnect". Rest of logging you can ignore it.

[log_not_closing.log](https://github.com/sockjs/sockjs-client/files/3905938/log_not_closing.log)

items.title: Probably a silly question, sorry.
items.body:
Hello, I am connecting to a 3rd party service that uses SockJS. They gave me an https:// url and I was able to build a very simple application that is able to connect to that service in JS using the SockJS client library.

However, I am trying to connect to it in C# and I'm not sure that the SockJS library available for c# actually works.

I've read that any SockJS server is available to connect over wss:// and when looking in my browser when running my JS application I see a connection to a wss:// server but I haven't been able to find the 'initial' URL. By the time the wss:// url shows up in Chrome it already has a session id on it and looks like this:

wss://hostname/ws/050/k2p35oq0/websocket so what URL would I use for just an initial websocket connection to this service on? Thanks for any help you can provide me with.

items.title: Refused to display 'http://jpt.jdbao168.com/endpoint/iframe.html#qd1bmcat' in a frame because it set 'X-Frame-Options' to 'deny'.
Multiple Websocket connections
items.body: Is there a way or feature I can use to tell how many websocket connections the client has made to the server?  I would like to be able to manage these and ensure there should only be one.  The reason for the question is because I'm seeing at the server http logs multiple xhr_streaming calls originating from the same client.  It does not happen all the time, for the most part, there's only one connection which is good but there are cases where we're seeing multiple connections which we would like to prevent as this could max out server connection resources.

currently the following issue occurs in the client when the socket is forwarded by an nginx proxy:

The issue is not occurring when the socket is directly connected to the service without nginx proxy.
The frontend is written in angular 7 and uses the "vertx3-eventbus-client" library which uses the sockjs client.

Could you please explain why the issue occurs and how to avoid it?

Best regards,
Ingo

items.title: Is it possible to allow 127.0.0.1 when accessed under secure domain?
items.body: Chrome allows loading resources from http://127.0.0.1 AFAICT and it helps local developments a lot. webpack-dev-server usually serves resources at http://127.0.0.1 also (and sometimes on a different port against the main express/egg service for better build performance).

items.title: "SecurityError: An insecure SockJS connection" should be ignored when using "localhost"
items.body:
Hi,

Referencing that line: https://github.com/sockjs/sockjs-client/blob/master/lib/main.js#L79

I think there should be an exception when the websocket is running on localhost. It's basically rare to have https:// running on localhost, and for the same reason a brower will allow to load unsecure content from localhost when the main site is https, there should be a check on the host.

Hope that makes sense :)

items.title: Sockjs Stomp through AWS Api Gateway
items.body:
Hi everyone, 

I am developing an web app, using Stomp over Sockjs. I also have a RabbitMQ server in order to manage websockets connections.
The problem is that I have all setted up through AWS Api Gateway. So in my client when I try to connect to websocket behind the Api Gateway I have this error: 

> WebSocket connection to 'wss://{url}/v1/audit/221/3d0ozc1y/websocket' failed: Error during WebSocket handshake: Unexpected response code: 400

I think that I am missing something about it, becouse all the traffic is over HTTPS, but behind I suppose that Sockjs or Stomp is trying to send a request through wss protocol and I dont have a handler for it in the api gateway.

I am wondering to know if someone have faced an issue like this and can give me some insight to solve it.

Thanks you all.

items.title: Connection aborted due to invalid data in the socket in Firefox
items.body:
This bug was filed @ https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1536843 and also https://github.com/facebook/create-react-app/issues/6720, but it seems like the bug is here in sockjs-client (I think?).

There's STR in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1536843#c0.

> It shows that the websocket handshake is successful, few frames are received, but then the connection is aborted due to invalid data in the socket.

> In the end, I was able to reproduce it and mozregression pointed to a bug 1417463. That bug changed default accept header and further testing showed that it's server side issue. For some reason, server goes mad when "text/html" is missing in the accept header and after few frames it sends some unexpected HTTP response over the websocket connection.

> I.e. this bug happens in Firefox 65 too when text/html is removed from network.http.accept.default pref in about:config.

items.title: net::ERR_ADDRESS_UNREACHABLE
chrome70 + stompjs + sockjs-client + java spring boot 2.0 connect too slow
cookie policy to support rfc6265
items.body:
Hi,

I am using sockjs-client (version: 1.1.5) with XHR_streaming transport. The backend server is behind AWS CLB and sticky session is configured using AWSELB cookie which contains "max-age" attribute.

recently we have encountered issues with the CLB not propegating client dis-connections to the BE server (due to multiplexing), and we consider moving to AWS ALB however we are expirencing issues with the sticky session as it contains attribute "Expires" which is part of rfc6265. 
we get the following worning:
WARN o.a.h.c.p.ResponseProcessCookies: Invalid cookie header: "Set-Cookie: AWSALB=[cookieId]; Expires=Mon, 28 Jan 2019 15:12:45 GMT; Path=/". Invalid 'expires' attribute: Mon, 28 Jan 2019 15:12:45 GMT

according to the code of object ResponseProcessCookies (package org.apache.http.client) when this warning message appear the cookie will not be processed, and will not be added to the out message, and sticky session will not work.

searching for this issue in google I found that in order for the http client to support this attribute we need to set cookie policy to: standard. (current value is: default)

I didn't find any way to set this cookie policy via the sockjs-client API's, is there any chance it exists and I missed it, or can this be added?

Thanks
Eran Talbi

items.title: Firecamp welcomes SockJS
items.body:
First of all, Thank you all @contributor for bringing this awesome WS emulator in the world.

I need your help and feedback for my mission, I am on the mission to `making developers life easier, every day`. So I am building the [Firecamp](https://firecamp.io), It’s a campsite for all the real-time technology. where  developers can test, debug and manage every realtime event **without creating or being dependent on any frontend.**

[Firecamp](https://firecamp.io) has one feature `auto code snippet generator`, where devs can easily get code snippets in every client language within a single click based on their saved request. A [SocketIO](http://socket.io) code snippet is in the below screenshot.  

[Firecamp](https://firecamp.io) has already integrated [SocketIO](http://socket.io) and WebSocket, now next one is [SockJS](http://sockjs.org).

Now I am planning to build this auto code snippet generator engine for the SockJS, So I am gathering all the SockJS client libs to review their code blocks for connection, close, send and other methods.

Here I have come across the list which I have found so far, please help me to find more if any and sort list the below libs based on their popularity.

I’ll really appreciate it and share the credit for your contribution, Thank in advance.



**[SockJS](http://sockjs.org) client libraries**

> paython - https://github.com/amagee/sockjs-client
> C# - https://github.com/jarhf/JarhfStomp4Net
> java - https://github.com/jaysridhar/spring-websocket-client/tree/master/src/main/java/sample
> android- https://github.com/vishal-raj/SockJsClientAndroid
> objective c and swift- https://github.com/jeremyfa/openfl-sockjs
> dart- https://github.com/nelsonsilva/sockjs-dart-client/tree/master/example
> go- https://github.com/lavab/sockjs-go-client/blob/master/client.go

**[SocketIO code snippet](https://twitter.com/FirecampHQ/status/1073561820164702210)**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5078921/50882537-191c6d80-140b-11e9-9282-33411f50c803.png)

items.title: Webstomp not working after RabbitMQ upgrade
items.body:
Hi there. We are no longer able to connect to webstomp via sock.js after RabbitMQ upgrade to 3.7 and wondering if there are any changes we may be missing?

This worked on previous version (3.6.x) on the same server. Webstomp used to work fine, it only stopped working since our RabbitMQ version upgrade. The stomp and webstomp plugins show as enabled in CLI.

We can successfully connect over websocket, example with this URL ws://142.93.184.186:15674/ws 
However, http://142.93.184.186:15674/stomp no longer works.

Very perplexed. Any helpful suggestions? Also tried various other ports like 15672.

Running this test on DO using Rancher. We use Sock.JS 1.1.5. Will upgrade and test again but the changelog does not indicate anything that would relate.

items.title: Why webstomp client over sockJs gets disconnected automatically
items.body:
I use webstomp client over SockJs for streaming certain information from server.

I use spring boot at server side with below configuration.

sockJS:
  streamBytesLimt: 4194304
  serverHeartbeatMs: 5000
  clientHeartbeatMs: 5000
stomp:
  sendBufferSizeLimit:10485760
  messageSizeLimit:5242880
  sendTimeOut: 30000

It works usually but if we keep the browser open for a long time, client gets disconnected and doesn't get reconnected until being refreshed. 


I noticed below sequence of events when the issue appears  

1)For some reason request(xhr) doesn't go from webstomp client (checked in Network 
  tab of chrome)
2)Unless stomp client is connected, we dont send heartbeat.
3) when server realizes session is ideal for more than (60s), websocket 
 closes the session
4) Then Error block of webstomp client 's connection request gets executed.
5) Then I try reconnecting after disconnecting gracefully, And 1,2,3,4 
  continues until page  is being refreshed

items.title: null is not an object (evaluating 'this._transport.transportName')
items.body:
Using Sentry to report user exceptions, I get a lot of the following error:

    null is not an object (evaluating 'this._transport.transportName')

I believe it's coming from:

https://github.com/sockjs/sockjs-client/blob/0ab53b8bf24ead0df4bed488333ceb9e81b8c1b7/lib/main.js#L311

I have a separate issue where I'm unable to use the minified version due to #393. Since I'm using the non-minified version, the `debug()` calls are still there in the code and cause this issue.

It looks like some kind of a race condition where the connection is closed before `_open()` is called. It's only the next line that checks for that case. The `debug()` call assumes the connection is open and accesses `_transport` like it's open.

I'm not sure what the best solution for this would be, but in my case I just commented out that line and it seems to resolve the issue.

items.title: Socket is closed before connection RTT issue
items.body:
when connecting on slow networks it seems that the socket connection is closed before the handshake is complete, what makes the connection to fail and try other transport protocols. (xhr streaming...)

i have modified the rtt value to some constant value of 10 sec (yes its a lot but just to see if it is the issue) and it seems to solve this problem.

is there any way to set the rtt or rto value before the connection is started?

from what i see in the sockjs.js file in the dist, the rtt is computed on run time and the rto is set accordingly.

i am using wss connectivity with angularjs and angular 5 projects with spring boot as backed server.

my deployment involves some vlans, vpns and also docker overlay network what might cause some slow networking in times, and the compute of the rto is not correct or too little.

it will be nice to have some way to manual set this values.

my current solution is a dirty work around involving modifying the dist sockjs.js file and integrate it to the project without npm.

please advise.

Hi there,

How can I send a blob from sockjs-client to aiohttp-sockjs? I've tryied but there's just [object Blob] result. Right now I'm reading the data with File (window.File, window.FileReader), then encoding to base64, JSON.stringfying it and sending through sockjs, then decoding on server side. But that sometimes corrupts my stream, uses more CPU.. it's not the best way to do it, I guess...
I just need to send a webm file through websockets by chunks, then build it on server side, convert it, whatever.

items.title: Infinite request loop when server sends status code 200
items.body:
Through another condition our load-balancer sent code 200 on those sockjs /xhr/../xhr_streaming requests.
sockjs handles this with an extreme infinite loop of requests.

This is dangerous, as it hammers down the whole network, if there are enough open browser windows.

Of course it is wrong to send the 200 response, but the result is so harmful, that a general handling to prevent those fast request loops within sockjs would be really good.

items.title: version is very outdated. CORS issue cause crash React Native Android app
items.body:
first you see ```java.lang.String cannot be cast to java.lang.Boolean``` message and spending 2 days to find out why. then you in try to find out why github version of sockets-client 1.1.4 is different to local, clean-fetch-retrieve - nothing helps. then somehow you understand - file lib/browser/abstrach-xhr.js is very outdated and it tagged as 1.1.4

line 74 from release 1.1.4:
```js
this.xhr.withCredentials = 'true';
```

same line from the actual:
```js
this.xhr.withCredentials = true;
```

please release correct version

 @ multi (webpack)-dev-server/client?http://0.0.0.0:8080 ./src/ts/index.tsx
```

The Spring documentation has changed, the correct link is now:

items.title: jsessionid in url
items.body:
If url rewriting is used for jsessionid then url for info request is composed incorrectly:
```
http://example.com/ws;jsessionid=123/info?t=1524833037318
```
Looks like that the following code does not take into account that url could contain jsessionid:
https://github.com/sockjs/sockjs-client/blob/436e997549f3937cc16bd5085addb218d43cfb60/lib/utils/url.js#L39

Thank you

items.title: info request timeout

labels.name: inactive
labels.description: Issue closed due to lack of response from original poster

items.body:
Hi,

I explained the details in Stackoverflow Post [1]. 
I use Spring Boot 2.0.0 Release as backend, SockjsClient 1.1.4, StompJs 2.3.3.
I want to use token based (jwt) authentication while connecting to websocket. As you may know, STOMP does not support http headers, so I would like to send my token in payload. Then, I will parse the `nativeHeaders` of payload within my `ChannelInterceptor` class. However,

When STOMP tries to connect websocket, it fails and the consol output is below.
```
Opening Web Socket...stomp.min.js:8:1737
XHRGET http://192.168.0.58:8080/api/v3/websocket/info?t=1523523409064 [HTTP/1.1 200  14ms]
XHRGET http://192.168.0.58:8080/api/v3/websocket/181/q2ln1go4/eventsource 
XHRGET http://192.168.0.58:8080/api/v3/websocket/181/ebux3w0b/eventsource
XHRPOST http://192.168.0.58:8080/api/v3/websocket/181/s5uv2w1e/xhr?t=1523523412548
Whoops! Lost connection to http://192.168.0.58:8080/api/v3/websocket stomp.min.js:8:1737
```

If, I make wait 2 seconds before returning the info request on Server side, STOMP successfully connects and subscribes. The console output;

```
Opening Web Socket... stomp.min.js:8:1737
XHRGET http://192.168.0.58:8080/api/v3/websocket/info?t=1523523529512  [HTTP/1.1 200  2012ms]
Web Socket Opened...  stomp.min.js:8:1737
>>> CONNECT
x-auth-token:{{my_token}}
accept-version:1.1,1.0
heart-beat:0,10000
�                                                 stomp.min.js:8:1737
<<< CONNECTED
version:1.1
heart-beat:0,0
user-name:admin
�                                                  stomp.min.js:8:1737
connected to server undefined       stomp.min.js:8:1737
>>> SUBSCRIBE
id:sub-0
destination:/user/queue/admin
�
```

Does anyone has an idea? Also I'm wondering what is the purpose of `/eventsource` requests? Because, if I wait 2 seconds or not, the response of `/info` requests same. If server returns 10-20ms, stomp starts to make `/eventsource` request, however If the response of` /info` requests took ~2 seconds, it did not.





[1] = https://stackoverflow.com/questions/49774655/spring-security-and-websocket-with-jwt-token

But the token is in rootscope it is not expired. Why this onclose event is called even though connection is ok. Due to this this is making multiple connection and subscription. Any idea how can i avoid this.?
infinite loop of xhr_streaming traffic c[3000, "Go away!"]
items.body:
we are using sockjs-client version 1.1.2.
our backend written in java with spring 4

the socket is working and delivering all our messages but chrome page crashes after several minutes.
we are encountering a batch of  xhr_streaming traffic c[3000, "Go away!"] and it looks like this is the sourse of the failure:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18754684/35320082-3d1cd82a-00eb-11e8-8221-fb98d84bdb20.png)

we've tried the following:
1. upgrade sockjs from 1.1.0 -> 1.1.2
2.  used this workaround: 
if (!self.pollIsClosing) { self.emit('close', code || 1006, reason); self.removeAllListeners(); }
without success
3. changed the protocols order and combinatios
4. followed the steps that you've mentioned in this thread:
https://github.com/sockjs/sockjs-client/issues/308


please advise

items.title: SockJS connection rejected because of CORS rules

labels.name: inactive
labels.description: Issue closed due to lack of response from original poster

items.body:
In XHR default client, the "withCredentials" is set to true by default: 
https://github.com/sockjs/sockjs-client/blob/a1028ed46db22e0f98d5529c0828529a8521ca6f/lib/transport/browser/abstract-xhr.js#L75

The comment above says:
```
// Mozilla docs says https://developer.mozilla.org/en/XMLHttpRequest :
// "This never affects same-site requests."

```
but in fact, the Mozilla doc doesn't say this anymore...

And this seems to be causing some issues when running SockJS client from a static HTML page served from the local file system (URL with file://) or when used within a mobile webview object , because the "Origin" header set by the majority of browsers is "null" (tested on Safari, Chrome and Firefox).

This leads to the following error when SockJS tries to connect thru websocket transport and first wants to get the "info" for the websocket connection :

```
Failed to load [xxxx__removed__xxxx]/eventbus/info?t=1513268107382: 
The value of the 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header in the response must not be the wildcard '*' when the request's credentials mode is 'include'. Origin 'null' is therefore not allowed access. The credentials mode of requests initiated by the XMLHttpRequest is controlled by the withCredentials attribute.
```

On server side we must keep '*' as the Access-Control-Allow-Origin because the connection must be kept opened to any incoming domain.

Commenting out line 75 of abstract-xhr transport resolves the issue, and SockJS still works fine in a "normal" context (when the page using SockJS is served on a standard web server thru http or https).

I'm wondering whether this can be completely removed, or whether something can be done to set the XHR withCredentials parameter from SockJS options or any transport options ?

Thanks for your feedback!

items.title: Veracode violation CWE ID 80 reported in sockjs version 0.3.4
items.body:
Hi,

I am using sockjs on wrapped inside AngularJS 1.x to implement web socket communication. For every production deployment, Veracode static scan is run on the codebase to detect potential security violations in JS files.

In a recent scan, Veracode reported the violation given below:

![veracode-xss-cweid80](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20185422/33647005-a594ba24-da78-11e7-8b04-3241efc976da.png)

The exact line of code where the violation is reported is given below:

![sockjs-veracode-violation](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20185422/33647033-d7c32b98-da78-11e7-899f-ef99277b177b.png)

From my initial analysis, sanitizing the input would fix this issue.

Can someone help me with the correct fix?

Thanks,
Saurabh

items.title: electron-net-module injection
items.body:
as i want sockjs to use the electron-net-module (which fully supports cross-platform system-proxy etc via libchromium) in an electron-desktop-app, i want to be able to inject it into https://github.com/sockjs/sockjs-client/blob/master/lib/transport/driver/xhr.js#L31. the electron-net-module (https://electronjs.org/docs/api/net) is a drop-in-replacement of node's http-module.

i have already tried to pass it through, but there are two call-paths to lib/transport/driver/xhr.js. first for the /info - handshake-request and second for the streaming-request. but that would mean to pass that electron-net-module through about 20 methods at the end.

an other option would be (and i already successfully tested it) is to create a common config.js-file within sockjs which is set in main.js with the passed options to SockJS-constructor and to require it whereever it is needed (in this case in xhr.js).

i would add this feature and create a pullrequest if you are interested to add it, and if you could give me some feedback to my proposals above or probably you have a much better idea to manage this 😅 .  thx

items.title: On webpack, SockJS gives this error in a way I can't exactly reproduce
items.body:
Hi there,

After doing some editing of react components and style files on webpack I get the following error on the browser's console:

```main.js?8e93:122 Uncaught TypeError: this._ir.once is not a function
    at new SockJS (138:122)
    at socket (118:9)
    at Object.eval (108:201)
    at eval (108:227)
    at Object.<anonymous> (app.[ext]:1442)
    at __webpack_require__ (app.[ext]:670)
    at fn (app.[ext]:88)
    at Object.<anonymous> (app.[ext]:2667)
    at __webpack_require__ (app.[ext]:670)
    at app.[ext]:716
SockJS @ main.js?8e93:122
socket @ socket.js?e5d0:9
(anonymous) @ client?cd17:201
(anonymous) @ client?cd17:225
(anonymous) @ app.[ext]:1442
__webpack_require__ @ app.[ext]:670
fn @ app.[ext]:88
(anonymous) @ app.[ext]:2667
__webpack_require__ @ app.[ext]:670
(anonymous) @ app.[ext]:716
(anonymous) @ app.[ext]:719
info-ajax.js?7213:21 Uncaught TypeError: this.xo.once is not a function
    at new InfoAjax (81:21)
    at Function.InfoReceiver._getReceiver (145:36)
    at InfoReceiver.doXhr (145:56)
    at eval (145:25)
InfoAjax @ info-ajax.js?7213:21
InfoReceiver._getReceiver @ info-receiver.js?aa33:36
InfoReceiver.doXhr @ info-receiver.js?aa33:56
(anonymous) @ info-receiver.js?aa33:25
setTimeout (async)
InfoReceiver @ info-receiver.js?aa33:24
SockJS @ main.js?8e93:121
socket @ socket.js?e5d0:9
(anonymous) @ client?cd17:201
(anonymous) @ client?cd17:225
(anonymous) @ app.[ext]:1442
__webpack_require__ @ app.[ext]:670
fn @ app.[ext]:88
(anonymous) @ app.[ext]:2667
__webpack_require__ @ app.[ext]:670
(anonymous) @ app.[ext]:716
(anonymous) @ app.[ext]:719
abstract-xhr.js?c769:21 Uncaught TypeError: self._start is not a function
    at eval (71:21)
```

`yarn list` gives the following:

```
yarn list v0.22.0
... various dependencies
└─ sockjs@0.3.18
└─ sockjs-client@1.1.4
└─ webpack@3.4.1
└─ webpack-dev-server@2.8.2
```

The only way out of it is restarting webpack, without any further change then webpack works as expected again (file-watching, page refresh and so on).

If seems like some people here are having a similar issue: https://github.com/rails/webpacker/issues/570

I don't know if related but I'm on a mac:

```
$ sw_vers
ProductName:    Mac OS X
ProductVersion: 10.12.6
BuildVersion:   16G29
```

and recently I've installed watchman over brew: https://facebook.github.io/watchman/docs/install.html 

Please tell me what other information I could supply, unfortunately this is a closed source project and I'm not allowed to share the code. Hopefully the stacktrace will be enough.

Thanks!

items.title: eventsource dependency too old: 0.1.6
items.body:
Hi, I just noticed that this library (used by webpack-dev-server btw) has a dependency to eventsource with a very old version: 0.1.6 ([released in Feb 2015](https://github.com/EventSource/eventsource/releases?after=v0.2.0)!).

I'm wondering why hasn't this been upgraded to a more recent version or even the latest one. It seems that there has been a lot of [bugs/issues fixed since version 0.1.6](https://github.com/EventSource/eventsource/blob/master/HISTORY.md) ;)

I noticed this since I'm implementing Server Sent Events in my app and I spotted two deps of the eventsource library in my package-lock.json. I use the latest version but I see that webpack-dev-server=>sockjs-client uses a very old one.

I thought this could be interesting for you...

items.title: Websocket stops fetching message and restore only if a user changes a tab in browser and back again
items.body: I have a simple app, where I have one topic for games events (using Spring boot WebSocket) and the second one for commands (CQRS) - I use STOMP as protocol. Every 1 second the client gets a "clock tick" event - it works perfectly until a user decides to send a command, then WebSocket stops getting any messages for 10 -  15 seconds - if a user changes a tab in the browser and back to the app again, messages start incoming again. The problem seems not to be server-side (messages are written into the socket without any pauses).

items.title: WebSockets failing and fallbacks failing as well

items.body:
I am constantly getting this issue while trying to use sockjs-client with Waterfox 54.0.0.1 (64-bit) I've noticed that there is an iframe.html that gets downloaded in the network tab that says ```

Don't panic!

This is a SockJS hidden iframe. It's used for cross domain magic.

``` And accordingly I do end up downloading `https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/sockjs/1.0.0/sockjs.min.js` I've noticed however that the included version of sockJS that is bundled is version 1.1.4 and I believe this is what is causing my version mismatch error. I believe this is an issue that may need to be fixed, although personally I am not quite sure how to fix it. It could also be that I myself am doing something wrong. If you could offer me any insight on this issue I would be extremely grateful!

items.title: How to use wss instead of ws when using https
items.body:
Hi

when using sockjs the client try to use ws instead of wss and after this it is fallback to xhr.
```
XHR finished loading: GET "http://127.0.0.1:8100/ws/info?t=1494413418627".
WebSocket connection to 'ws://127.0.0.1:8100/ws/166/l0nwezo5/websocket' failed: Connection closed before receiving a handshake response
XHR finished loading: POST "http://127.0.0.1:8100/ws/166/egcbr14a/xhr_send?t=1494413418764".
```
I test the connection with a connection via wss only and it work. but sockjs cant use it.
There was no XHR messages in the log.
When i use `const socket: WebSocket = new SockJS(url, void 0, {transport: ["wss", "https"]}) as WebSocket;` it cannot create a connection.

Do i understand the system right, is it using secure websockets? How can i force it to use secure websocket?

Lexanius
